<JD_START>
Job Title: Vice President of Finance

Location: Los Angeles, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Proper Hospitality is seeking an experienced Vice President of Finance to join our corporate team in Los Angeles. 
Reporting into the Sr. Vice President of Finance, this key role will be responsible for driving strong financial performance by working closely with each hotel's Directors of Finance/Controllers, ensuring aligned metrics for success are in place. The VP Finance will be responsible for overseeing financial controls, SOP’s and efficiencies.
Additional responsibilities include supervision of financial reporting, accounting, billing, collections, payroll and budgeting duties for Proper Hospitality, as well as coordination and management of the financial planning, procurement and investment activities of the company. 
Job Overview:Develop internal control policies, guidelines, and procedures for activities such as budget administration, cash and credit management, and accountingMaintain current knowledge of organizational policies and procedures, federal and state policies and directives, and current accounting standardsPrepare or direct preparation of financial statements, business activity reports, financial position forecasts, annual budgets, or reports required by regulatory agencies;Analyze the financial details of past, present, and expected operations to identify development opportunities and areas where improvement is needed;Monitor financial activities and details, such as cash flow and reserve levels, to ensure that all legal and regulatory requirements are met;Conduct or coordinate audits with Directors of Finance per property accounts and financial transactions to ensure compliance with state and federal requirements and statutes.
Qualifications:Minimum of 8-10 years in an Executive Level (Controller or Director of Finance) role in the hospitality industryMinimum of 3-5 years in regional experience requiredProficiency with Accounting softwareExcellent understanding of GAAPDemonstrated track record of success and career growth
Education: Bachelor's degree required; experience in luxury/lifestyle hotels is a plus
Company Overview: 
Proper Hospitality is made up of a diverse group of passionate individuals who share a common love for hotels and the art of hospitality. Our philosophy is simple: There is a right way to do things and anything less just isn’t proper. We are seeking out the “best of the best” from inside and outside of the industry to work alongside us as we grow a new kind of lifestyle Hospitality Company inspired by a centuries-old tradition. The work is challenging and fast-paced but rewarding above all.
We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, genetics, or any other federal/state protected category.
Proper Hospitality will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with local Fair Chance Hiring Ordinances.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
